item.title: Are We Safe Yet? The Limitations of Distributional Features for Fake News Detection
A Deep Learning Mammography-based Model for Improved Breast Cancer Risk Prediction
item.description: A DL model to triage a portion of mammograms as cancer free, improving performance and workflow efficiency.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Alignment of Contextual Word Embeddings, with Applications to Zero-shot Dependency Parsing
A Deep Learning Mammography-based Model for Improved Breast Cancer Risk Prediction
item.description: Deep learning models that use full-field mammograms yield substantially improved risk discrimination compared with the Tyrer-Cuzick (version 8) model.

item.title: Deep Learning Model to Assess Cancer Risk on the Basis of a Breast MR Image Alone
item.description: Our DL model can assess the 5-year cancer risk on the basis of a breast MR image alone, and it showed improved individual risk discrimination when compared with a state-of-the-art risk assessment model. These results offer promising preliminary data regarding the potential of image-based risk assessment models to support more personalized care.

item.title: Mammographic breast density assessment using deep learning: clinical implementation
item.description: This DL model can be used to assess mammographic breast density at the level of an experienced mammographer.

item.title: Optical Flow Requires Multiple Strategies (but only one network)

item.description: I’m a Ph.D. student at MIT CSAIL and a member of the NLP and Learn To Cure groups. My advisor is Prof. Regina Barzilay. Currently, I’m focusing on automatic fact-checking and on the geometry of contextual word embeddings. I have also worked on creating deep learning screening-based methods to improve cancer detection and risk assessment. Before coming to MIT, I was an MSc student in Computer Science at Tel Aviv University, advised by Prof.
